programme.title: Dateline NBC
programme.desc: Mysterious deaths occur inside a traveling commune, starting an investigation that lasts more than a decade; two sisters -- former commune members -- reveal stories that involve lies, lust and greed.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Just weeks before a witness is to testify against the man accused of sexually assaulting her, she is murdered in the front yard of her own home. Investigators immediately suspect her attacker, but they don't have enough evidence to prove his guilt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Three homicides on two continents looked like professional executions. Investigators on both sides of the Atlantic needed to find out if they were related and, if they were, who or what they had in common.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Colorado hunter who'd been shot three times was the victim of a well planned crime. Investigators suspected two weapons and two killers. But analysis of the forensic evidence pointed them in a different direction--one much closer to home.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A beautiful young woman fell to her death from a cliff overlooking the ocean. Initially, investigators thought it was a tragic accident. But after a forensic examination, police had a very different picture of what happened.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, a high school girl vanishes after attending a party. The prime suspect had not one but two alibi witnesses for the night she disappeared. A solid alibi can often overcome much circumstantial evidence. But forensic evidence is another matter.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1962, the people of the small town of Hanford, California lost their sense of peace when one of their own, 15-year-old Marlene Miller, was murdered.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1993, the Amtrak Railroad experienced the deadliest train crash in United States history when the Sunset Limited derailed while crossing Alabama's Big Bayou Canot bridge. Forty-seven passengers and crew were killed; scores more were injured.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Hikers near Anchorage, Alaska discovered a body wrapped in sheets which were edged in orange stitching. Clinging to the sheet, they also discovered a tuft of red carpet fibers _ threads of evidence which led them straight to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A young woman suddenly becomes critically ill, eventually leaving her unable to walk. A bone marrow test reveals the cause: arsenic. Investigators must determine if the poisoning was caused by groundwater contamination or something more sinister.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the apparent overdose suicide of Reverend Bill Guthrie's wife Sharon. Detectives suspect foul play after they recover incriminating files from Bill's computer and learn of his infidelity.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a fire destroyed most of a home and a young boy went missing, police organized the largest search in the history of their small town. First the boy's backpack was discovered five miles from home, and then his body was found 50 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1991, when the wife of a serviceman was brutally murdered in the Philippines, investigators had to reassemble a 5-1/4 inch computer disk which had been cut to pieces with pinking shears in order to find the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was 1957, and California police were searching for a man who had committed several crimes in one night, including murder. They followed thousands of leads but eventually the case turned cold. Almost 50 years later, with the help of advances in computer technology and handwriting analysis, investigators proved an old adage: You can run, but you can't hide.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A patrol officer is shocked by the amount of blood at a traffic accident and is shocked by the coroner's ruling until an anonymous phone call re-ignites the case.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A drive-by shooting leaves one man dead and another seriously wounded. Cell phone calls and shell casings point to a suspect, but authorities are unable to place him at the crime scene. A forensic geologist proves that dirt is anything but dumb.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of Katie Poirier is stymied by the lack of a body, but they find a few charred remains including a tooth. The tooth's filling contains unique properties that help investigators identify her remains. Further forensic evidence is then used to convict Donald Blom of her murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Forensic scientists work with the only clue recovered from a multiple-victim shooting: a 12-gauge shotgun. Scientists use unique methods to lift the serial number from the weapon in order to trace it to its owner.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: It was supposed to be a routine motorcade for the Queen of England. But on the way to Yosemite National Park, a car carrying three Secret Service agents collided with a car driven by a deputy from the local sheriff's office.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A fire erupted in Kings Cross Station in London, killing 31 people and injuring dozens more. Investigators pinpointed the cause of the fire, but it took state-of-the-art technology and fluid dynamics experts to explain why it became a deadly inferno.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: In 1988, the body of a young woman was discovered in an Ohio river. Most of the evidence had been washed away, but the victim's 6 year-old son unwittingly told investigators all they needed to know...without saying a word. The clue was in his genes.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The 1987 disappearance of Houston resident Tracy Jo Shine is recalled. The investigation went cold until 2000 when a 'cold case squad' learned that the woman's ex-boyfriend Michael Neal had bragged about killing her.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Two different men called police to report the same murder. Apparently, neither one knew that the other had called. The investigation uncovered even more unusual circumstances.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A Modesto, California teenager went missing. There was no sign of a struggle in her home, and police suspected she'd simply run away until her naked, bruised body was discovered in a ditch 20 miles away.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Rosemary Anderson is found dead on the side of the road, her boyfriend becomes the prime suspect. He eventually confessed to her murder, but so did another man _ serial killer, Eric Edgar Cooke.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man riding a bicycle was fatally injured, and police believed he was the victim of a hit-and-run accident. Tiny clues found at the scene created a picture of the vehicle which struck him and led police to its driver.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A 29-year-old woman was killed instantly when a bomb exploded in her home. The device was so powerful that shrapnel was embedded in houses across the street. The bomber had not only knowledge and skill, but also a motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A man disappears one year to the day after beginning an affair with his friend's wife. 15 years later, with the help of a metal detector, police found evidence which would prove what had happened, and who was responsible.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation of a discarded sleeping bag, containing bloody sneakers and a purse, leads police to the body of a young woman. A mark found on the victim's body would enable police to track the killer, Jesse Pratt.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an elderly couple died in a suspicious house fire, their son became the prime suspect. Investigators turned to forensic science to determine if the fire had been set deliberately, or if it was an unfortunate accident.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: How scientists solved a 1992 murder case involving cremation. It takes a long time and a very hot fire to cremate a human body, and thus destroy evidence of foul play. But the coroner who performed the autopsy on the body found telltale clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When Firefighters found an entire family dead inside their home, it seemed like a murder-suicide. But there were several inconsistent clues in the rubble. Could ballistics, a time card, and some secret audiotapes unravel the mystery?

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of 16-year-old Leanne Tiernan was discovered nine months after she disappeared. Forensic scientists found clues that painted a virtual portrait of her killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A behavioral profile caused the Baton Rouge Police Department to search for the wrong man. They might not have made an arrest had it not been for a DNA picture of the suspect painted by a molecular biologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is killed while walking her dogs in the woods. Since she had no enemies and her husband has an alibi, police assume it was a hunting accident...until a strange letter turns up allegedly written by the woman before her death.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A teenager went missing after an evening of horseback riding. Her body was found a month later, three miles from her home. The killer unknowingly left trace evidence behind _ tiny but unmistakable clues which pointed to him and him alone.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A high school gym teacher mysteriously left town, without saying goodbye to anyone. He later sent letters to explain why. But a closer forensic look at those letters, and a microscopic piece of tissue, gave investigators an entirely different explanation for where he went and why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a popular disc jockey was found murdered in a community garden, police swung into action. A sniffer dog and a blood spatter expert led police to the killer and he'd been much closer than they realized.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a victim is brutally murdered in his own bed, investigators find a shoe impression in the mud outside--physical evidence they hope will lead to the killer.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a young woman disappeared, police feared she was the latest victim in a string of similar crimes. A pair of bloody gloves, unique tire tracks, and ordinary grass and pine needles provided investigators with some extraordinary clues.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Bombings are difficult to solve, because the perpetrator isn't usually at the scene, and the evidence goes up in smoke. In this case pieces of plastic the size of grains of sand hold the key to a man's murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When a woman disappeared without a trace, there were two possible explanations: kidnapping or murder. Careful investigation, a forensic artist, and DNA profiling enabled police to find a single suspect, who was known to prey upon vulnerable women.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The body of a wealthy American businessman was found in his rental car. Teeth and bone fragments were the only remains. When the victim's wife files an insurance claim for $7 million, investigators seek the help of a renowned forensic anthropologist.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the kidnapping and rape of an 18-year-old Ohio woman is aided when the victim returns hours after the incident occurred. With her help, the police are able to track the assailant Craig Bailey to his front door.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A union official is executed in his home not long after a strike by the union membership. Neither his wife nor anyone in the neighborhood heard any gunshots. It would take a forensic sound test, an electron microscope, and a nightgown to explain why.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Relates the story of Paul Kenneth Keller, a serial arsonist responsible for several fires that caused millions of dollars worth of property damage and the deaths of three people. More than 75 Seattle-area arsons are probed before he was discovered, partly through the use of forensic hypnosis.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When an 11-year-old girl disappeared from a small town in a remote area of Alaska, investigators wondered if she'd been attacked by a bear or become lost in the dense woods. It turned out neither was true.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A two-man shrimp boat sank when a fast-moving, violent storm struck the Louisiana coast. The captain drowned, and the deckhand was rescued fourteen hours later. The deckhand was considered a hero until the captain's body was found.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A look back at the case of the River Park Rapist, who assaulted four women in South Bend, Ind., during 1996. Law enforcement officers arrested Richard Alexander, who was convicted in 1998 and sentenced to 70 years in prison.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A police officer accused of killing his estranged wife insists she committed suicide. Investigators say it was murder¾_ that it was physically impossible for the woman to have shot herself.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: A woman is shot to death in her store just one day before she is to testify against the man accused of robbing her. The robber becomes the prime suspect, but he has a solid alibi: a time-stamped videotape of his activities on the day of the murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: When police recovered the submerged car of a man reported missing, they expected to find his body _ but it wasn't there. The investigation which followed would uncover an obsession turned deadly, and the motive for murder.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: After a man's body is discovered a few miles from his home, police trace the crime back to his wife.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: For six years, a serial killer prowled the streets of New York City. He wrote letters to police and The New York Post, indicating he would kill twelve people, one for each astrological sign.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: The murder of an eccentric millionaire was not entirely unexpected; he flaunted his wealth and cared little for personal security. The evidence at the crime seemed to indicate robbery, but investigators wondered if there was something more.

programme.title: Forensic Files
programme.desc: Authorities track a kidnapper who allowed his victim, 17-year-old Shari Smith, to write a last will and testament on a note pad, then informed the family of her murder, as well as the later murder of a 10-year-old Debra May Helmick. A phone number written on a previous page left a lasting impression, which helped to convict Larry Gene Bell.

programme.title: Forensic Files

programme.desc: Un oficial de policía está desahuciado y espera la muerte con orgullo, por eso contrata a un hombre para que lo aniquile.

programme.title: Moisés y los diez mandamientos
programme.desc: La historia de Moisés desde su nacimiento y llegada a manos de la princesa Henutmire hasta llevar a su pueblo a la Tierra Prometida. Su crianza como un verdadero príncipe egipcio junto a su tío Ramsés.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: Álvaro acelera la firma de la carta de libertad de Isaura. Malvina se enfrenta a Leoncio y pone fin a su matrimonio. Blanca planea una trampa para Álvaro y culparlo de su embarazo.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: Álvaro le entrega a Isaura su carta de libertad y despide a Chico y Raymundo. Leoncio es humillado por el coronel, pero accede a darle una pensión. Joao llega para liberar a André, pero descubre que Isaura liberará a todos los esclavos.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: Todos están invitados a la celebración de la libertad de Isaura. Rosa no puede dejar de envidiar a Isaura. Blanca siente el deseo de matar a Isaura. Leoncio le pide a Chico su pistola y confiesa que planea secuestrar a Isaura.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: Blanca planea asesinar a Isaura. Álvaro anuncia su compromiso con Isaura. El coronel le hace saber a Rosa que no le dará la libertad hasta que esté preparada. Francisco le vende una pistola a Leoncio.

programme.title: La esclava Isaura
programme.desc: Flor de Lis se defiende de Leoncio. Geraldo le pide una oportunidad a Malvina, pero ella le pide tiempo. El sargento le declara su amor a Flor de Lis. Leoncio irrumpe en la habitación de Isaura amenazándola con la pistola que le compró a Francisco.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: Abraham está devastado por permitir que Saraí se case con el faraón y busca el consejo de Dios para saber qué camino seguir. El malvado seduce a una de las peregrinas débiles. Saraí se prepara para su boda con el faraón.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: Se festeja la boda entre Saraí y el faraón, pero algo muy extraño hace que los planes cambien. La presencia del enviado del mal es cada vez más intensa y sus poderes crecen. Dos jóvenes de la tribu desaparecen.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: El faraón padece una extraña enfermedad en la piel y se entera de que Saraí es esposa de Abraham. Saraí le informa a su esposo que el faraón ya sabe la verdad y que seguramente deberán partir. Un asesinato se lleva a cabo en silencio.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: Lot le pide a su tío Abraham separar sus ganados, ya que él nunca ha tenido algo propio en la vida. Tras desaparecer por un año, Massa regresa y descubre que Adalia se casó. Sodoma, una ciudad de excesos, tiene problemas con otras regiones.

programme.title: Génesis
programme.desc: Todos se preparan para dividir la caravana de Lot y la de Abraham, y todo lo que eso implica. Massa le pide a Abraham que lo deje quedarse en su caravana, pero con intenciones malévolas. El rey de Sodoma no quiere seguir pagando impuestos.

programme.title: Down In Flames
programme.desc: The discovery of a burned body on the side of the road in suburban Dallas, Texas kick starts a furious race to find a killer. With surveillance footage and a string of eyewitnesses, it takes local police less than 72 hours to identify the perpetrator, who did everything wrong in a foolish attempt to get away with murder.

programme.title: Animal Engineering
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at some amazing feats of construction by animals. He visits a beekeeper who shows the incredibly precise honeycomb formations made by bees. Then we visit a spider display in Los Angeles and look closely at the intricacies of a spider web. Philippe travels to Pennsylvania where a beaver has been building several dams all by himself. We'll also look at various types of bird nests, including a bird that actually builds a false entrance to fool potential prey.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin gets wedged in a wild Arkansas cave and Ryan can't help but laugh. Above ground, the team spreads kindness in a rural community, gives a man a guitar worth singing about, and Jimmy Luv finds courage to confess his crush to an Olympian.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Americas Most Delish

programme.title: Breaking Chains

programme.title: Rivers and Lakes
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits Chicago on the shores of Lake Michigan, and discovers the canals that run through this city. Then we go to Lake Seneca in New York, where high school students test the water quality. Philippe travels to Philadelphia where scientists monitor a creek by gathering fish in an unusual way. Then we head north to Quebec City, where in the winter, the St. Lawrence River becomes a frozen river.

programme.title: Animal Engineering
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at some amazing feats of construction by animals. He visits a beekeeper who shows the incredibly precise honeycomb formations made by bees. Then we visit a spider display in Los Angeles and look closely at the intricacies of a spider web. Philippe travels to Pennsylvania where a beaver has been building several dams all by himself. We'll also look at various types of bird nests, including a bird that actually builds a false entrance to fool potential prey.

programme.title: The Danny Moses Show
programme.desc: Danny Moses ("The Big Short") cuts through the market noise to simplify the week's financial headlines and trends, with unique insights and special guests.

programme.title: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: This episode features a variety of animals found on land, and in the sea. Find out how sharks are able to sleep while they swim. And how the Arctic Fox survives in temperatures that can drop to 70 below.

programme.title: Rivers and Lakes
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits Chicago on the shores of Lake Michigan, and discovers the canals that run through this city. Then we go to Lake Seneca in New York, where high school students test the water quality. Philippe travels to Philadelphia where scientists monitor a creek by gathering fish in an unusual way. Then we head north to Quebec City, where in the winter, the St. Lawrence River becomes a frozen river.

programme.title: Animal Engineering
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau looks at some amazing feats of construction by animals. He visits a beekeeper who shows the incredibly precise honeycomb formations made by bees. Then we visit a spider display in Los Angeles and look closely at the intricacies of a spider web. Philippe travels to Pennsylvania where a beaver has been building several dams all by himself. We'll also look at various types of bird nests, including a bird that actually builds a false entrance to fool potential prey.

programme.title: Road Trip

programme.title: Living Large
programme.desc: Featured on the countdown are kids strutting their stuff, a bird’s eye view of glides and planes and a wedding party gone bad.

programme.title: Your Childhood Your Parents Hope You Won't Remember
programme.desc: Capturing the golden years, the countdown reflects on grandpa’s awkward dip in the pool, priceless parental pranks and family photo shoots that fall flat.

programme.title: Things They Just Don't Teach You In Clown College
programme.desc: Festive times are here again with pool party hijinks, runaway birthday cakes and wacky weddings landing on the countdown.

programme.title: Judgment Of Dharun Ravi With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Rutgers freshman Tyler Clementi and Dharun Ravi had only been roommates for few weeks when Ravi decided to secretly film Tyler kissing another man. Soon after, Clementi took his own life and Ravi faced surprising criminal charges.

programme.title: Judgment Of The Blue Moon Killer With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: The murders of Voncile Smith and her sons John and Richard set Pensacola, Florida on edge. Was it an occult ritual? Or related to secret government work? Or was it something much more basic – greed.

programme.title: Friend Or Foe
programme.desc: In Lexington, Kentucky, a newly wed wife parties like there's no tomorrow until a body is dumped on a golf course. In Brisbane, Australia, a mannequin on the street highlights there are fears for the safety of a missing wife.

programme.title: Romance Is Dead
programme.desc: In Poughkeepsie, New York, a Police officer discovers evidence his wife is guilty of cheating on him leading to a deadly encounter, while in Orlando, Florida, a newly wed wife gets herself a boy toy with fatal results.

programme.title: Hard to Swallow
programme.desc: In Pleasant Grove, Utah, a former beauty queen goes under the knife to look sexier for her husband but the romance quickly comes to a horrifying end. In Hazel Park, Michigan, a wife learns to shoot, but doesn't realize she's become a target!
